Camera Class Functions and atribiutes

class dorsaPylon.Collector(camera_class=None)
enable_camera_emulation(count: int)

enable camera emulation device for testing and developing purpose

Parameters:

count (int) – number of emulation device

get_all_cameras(camera_class=None) → list[dorsaPylon.Camera]

return list of available devices

Examples

>>> cameras = collector.get_all_cameras(CamersClass.gige)
Parameters:

  • camera_class (_type_, optional) – filter devices by camera class like Gige or USB.

  • flags (- you can use CamersClass.*) –

  • None (- if be) –

  • None. (return all cameras in diffrents class. Defaults to) –

Returns:

list of cameras in determined class

Return type:

List[Camera]

get_all_serials() → list[str]

return list of serialnumber of available cameras

get_available_devices(camera_class=None) → list[dorsaPylon.Camera]

return list of available devices .. rubric:: Examples

return all gige devices >>> founded = collector.get_available_devices(CamersClass.gige)

Parameters:

  • camera_class (_type_, optional) – filter devices by camera class like Gige or USB.

  • CamersClass.* (- it could be) –

  • None (- if be) –

  • None. (return all devices in diffrents class. Defaults to) –

Returns:

list of devices in determined class

Return type:

List[pyplone.device]

get_camera_by_serial(serial_number: str) → Camera

get a camera by its serial number

Parameters:

serial_number (str) – serial number of camera

Return type:

Camera

listDevices()

print information of available devices

class dorsaPylon.Camera(camera_device: InstantCamera)

_summary_

build_converter(pixel_type)

build a converter to determine the pixel type like RGB or MONO8

build_zero_image()

return a zero image with the dimensions of the camera image

getPictures(grabResult=None, img_when_error='zero') → ndarray

return an image if camera caReturns an image if the camera has captured an image

Parameters:

  • grabResult (_type_, optional) – grabResult of camera. generally used for event. Defaults to None.

  • img_when_error (str, optional) – determine what returns when the captured image got an error. Defaults to ‘zero’.

Returns:

captured image

Return type:

np.ndarray

reset()

Reset all camera settings

search_in_nodes(*keywords) → list[str]

search in camera nodes by one or more keywords to find your intended feature

Returns:

List of nodes name that contains keywords

Return type:

List[Str]

software_trige_exec()

execute software trigger

class dorsaPylon.CameraInfo(camera_object: Camera)
get_class() → str

return calas of camera in Str type like BaslerGigE and BaslerUSB

get_model() → str

return model of camera in Str type

get_serialnumber() → str

return serial number of camera in Str type

is_GigE() → bool

return True if camera is GigE class

is_PRO() → bool

return True if camera is Pro model

is_USB() → bool

return True if camera is USB class

class dorsaPylon.CameraParms(camera_object: Camera)
availble_node_values(node_name: str)

returns list of available values for specific node by its name .. rubric:: Examples

>>> camera.Parms.availble_node_values('ExposureMode')
>>> ('Timed',)
Parameters:

  • node_name (str) – node name. you can find it by search in camera nodes using

  • method (`Camera.search_in_nodes `) –

Returns:

_description_

Return type:

_type_

availble_triggerselector_values() → tuple[str]

return avaible value for TriggerSelector node of camera

Returns:

avaible value for TriggerSelector node of camera

Return type:

tuple[str]

availble_triggersource_values() → tuple[str]

return avaible value for TriggerSource node of camera

Returns:

avaible value for TriggerSource node of camera

Return type:

tuple[str]

get_exposureTime() → int

get ExposureTime of camera

get_gain() → int

get gain of camera

get_node(node_name: str)

get value of specefic node by its name .. rubric:: Examples

>>> camera.Parms.get_node('GainRaw')
>>> 230
Parameters:

  • node_name (str) – node name. you can find it by search in camera nodes using

  • method (`Camera.search_in_nodes `) –

Returns:

value of node

Return type:

_type_

get_roi() → tuple[int, int, int, int]

return roi parameters of camera

Returns:

offset_x, offset_y, h, w

Return type:

tuple[ int, int, int, int]

get_trigger_mode() → str

return trigger mode value (On or Off)

get_trigger_option() → tuple[str, str]

return values of TriggerSource and TriggerSelector

Returns:

source, selector

Return type:

tuple[str, str]

set_all_parms(gain=None, exposure=None, width=None, height=None, offset_x=None, offset_y=None, trigger=None, trigge_source=None, trigge_selector=None)

Set commonly used parameters at once ** If any parameter is set to None, that parameter will not be set on the camera

set_exposureTime(exposure: int) → None

set ExposureTime of camera

set_gain(gain: int) → None

set gain of camera

set_node(node_name: str, value)

set value to specefic node by its name .. rubric:: Examples

>>> camera.Parms.set_node('GainRaw', 230)
Parameters:

  • node_name (str) – node name. you can find it by search in camera nodes using

  • method (`Camera.search_in_nodes `) –

  • value (_type_) –

set_roi(height: int, width: int, offset_x: int, offset_y: int) → None

set roi of camera

Parameters:

  • height (int) – height of camera

  • width (int) – width of camera

  • offset_x (int) –

  • offset_y (int) –

set_transportlayer(packet_delay: int, packet_size=None) → None

set packet_delay and packet_size of camera

Parameters:

  • packet_delay (int) –

  • packet_size (int, optional) – Defaults to None.

set_trigger_off() → None

trun trigger Off

set_trigger_on() → None

trun trigger On

set_trigger_option(source: str, selector='FrameStart') → None

setup trigger option ( trigger source and trigger selector) .. rubric:: Examples

>>> camera.Parms.set_trigger_option(Trigger.source.software, Trigger.selector.frame_start)
Parameters:

  • source (str) – source of trigger Trigger.source.software Trigger.hardware_line1

  • selector (_type_, optional) – trigger selector. Defaults to Trigger.selector.frame_start.

class dorsaPylon.CameraStatus(camera_object: Camera)
get_tempreture() → float

return device tempreture

Returns:

device tempreture

Return type:

float

is_grabbing() → bool

return True if camera is grabbing

is_open() → bool

return True if camera be open

is_trigger_on() → bool

return True if trigger be On

class dorsaPylon.CameraOperations(camera_object: Camera)
close()

close camera

open()

Open camera

start_grabbing(strategy=1)

start grabbing. it is necessary for capture image. - If the camera is not open, this function will do it automatically

Parameters:

strategy (_type_, optional) – strategy of grabbing image. Defaults to pylon.GrabStrategy_LatestImageOnly.

stop_grabbing()

stop grabbing
